intro: Scutellaria purpurascens subsp. verecunda, commonly known as the purple scutellaria, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, often found in forest understories or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal studies.
